sourceMeaningMnemonic: There's a <radical>mountain</radical> coming out of the <radical>ground</radical> that you want to climb, but your <radical>forehead</radical> needs a <radical>towel</radical> for all your sweat. You don't have a towel, so you take off your <kanji>belt</kanji> and tie it around your forehead.
meaningInfo: The belt is easy to tighten and it catches all the sweat before it can fall into your eyes. It isn't quite as absorbent as a towel though.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>belt</kanji> isn't absorbent enough, so you wrap it in your <reading>tie</reading> (<ja>たい</ja>) and then tie the whole thing around your forehead again.
readingInfo: It works! Your belt tied in a tie is the perfect invention!
